ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: The readings for this course were very interesting and helpful. I also felt that I learned a lot for the class discussions and there were some students in the course that were very knowledgeable about the subject matter and added a lot of insight to the class discussions.
Professor Kotchen made the class overall fun and interesting. However, he was not always fully prepared for class and depended too much on student preparation.
Fascinating class that looks at non-traditional environmental solutions through traditional spheres of economics and psychology.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: Professor Kotchen is very knowledgeable about the subject matter and guided the discussions so that they were focused and meaningful. The small class size and ability to have structured class discussion was very conducive to gaining an in depth understanding of the subject matter. Being able to meet with the instructor and the Teaching Fellow before our weekly presentations was very helpful and I feel that I was able to enhance my presentation skills.
The course format is unique. The papers and topics were very interesting/relevant for environmental management.
I loved the course's structure and students' responsibility.
The seminar was very free flowing and forced people to think critically and creatively about contemporary issues.
When students were actively engaged and we had meaningful conversations
The format of the class worked really well. I enjoyed the discussion aspect and the opportunity to interact with the presenters and other students.
The readings were great.
I like the style of the course -- student presentations, reading responses, then 3 hours for discussion facilitated by Professor Kotchen. Having the time to really dig into some hard questions.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: I think there maybe could have been more variation in presentations ad assignments.

I would have liked for Professor Kotchen to structure more time for lecturing as part of this class. Since the class was entirely student presentation based, some presentations were more or less engaging and it was sometimes hard to sit through a full 3 hours of presentations each week. One suggestion would be for the discussions of each paper to be shorter and then Professor Kotchen could spend 30 minutes at the end of each class tying the concepts together or explaining the technical aspects of a paper.

I would appreciate two or three 15-minute lectures related to economists' methodology in general. This could include statistical tests, experimental design, and other topics in research methodology. Separately, I feel like "Green Markets" is a catchy title but doesn't have a meaning beyond Kotchen's 2006 paper. "Private Provision of Public Goods" and "Voluntary and Information Based Approaches to Environmental Management" are more specific but not exactly inspiring. How about Consumer and Corporate Environmental Behavior or something like that?
Would be better if it met twice a week for shorter periods of time.

I would have liked to move beyond the articles more and apply the concepts more to real-life situations or how we can use this information to guide our decisions as environmental managers. Wish there had been something other than non-scientific peer reviewed articles for reading.
Really wish there had been more context and instruction from the professor.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: I wish Kotchen did more lecturing. Some students are really poor presenters and it was painful to sit through some of their presentations. Perhaps there is a way for Kotchen to take a larger role is presenting the information and guiding discussion.

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: I am interested in CSR and how it can be applied to broader society. Looking at how economic theory plays into people's decision-making and how innovative economic studies can help inform policy/trends was very relevant to the general course of study at FES.

I'm interested in the economics of energy and the environment. This course was perfect. I know I benefited from reading a variety of papers very closely and understanding the methodology and foundational literature.
Unique support of standard environmental coursework.
It fits in very well. This course was a perfect opportunity to explore literature on voluntary green markets, which is a critical part of my academic and professional focus.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: I took this course because I really like the professor and I felt that it is an area wherein I am lacking knowledge.
I feel that this course explores the way in which change must come because of the policy making gridlock in government.
Interested in behavior change.
It was recommended by other students. They said it was a great discussion course, unlike anything else they had taken at F&ES or other professional schools.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: Yes
Yes
Yes
Surpassed my expectations. I was beyond excited to go to every class, and the readings were always very interesting.
Yes it did.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Nothing toshow..

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: I think it is a good course for students who are interested in the social construct or economic incentives pertaining to environmental initiatives. I felt like I did not always have as much time as I wanted to spend on the readings, reflections, and presentations. It would have helped if I could do some other readings more than once to get a more thorough understanding.
Do it! Don't even think about it.
Take if you enjoy reading dense articles.
